Explore the Case study:
R1 Public University Shortens Response Times for FOIA Requests

Limited resources can severely impact the efficacy and efficiency of any legal team. One of our customers, the office of general counsel for a public R1 university, armed with a small team of just ten attorneys and three legal assistants, found it challenging to handle the high volume of Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests.

Learn how the university’s office of general counsel uses Everlaw to meet the challenges that come with responding to FOIA requests and develop better workflows by leveraging email threading, easy-to-apply redactions, and powerful search capabilities.

Turning to Tech: How to Ease the Burden of Responding to Public Records and FOIA Requests

More and more, federal, state, and local government agencies are turning to technology to help ease the burden and expedite response times to public records and Freedom of Information (FOI) requests. Learn how the Ohio AGO and the State of Indiana respond to the growing number of requests in an efficient and timely manner.
They cover:

  • How to handle new and emerging data types
  • Identifying responsive documents and redacting sensitive information

Setting the Bar in Cloud Security

Data security, infrastructure security, product security, and data privacy concerns are top-of-mind for government professionals. The highly sensitive and confidential nature of public records and the critical security concerns of FOIA and public records responses inherently makes protecting data a top priority for leaders in the field. Everlaw makes your security mission, ours. Everlaw’s approach to security and compliance is holistic and part of our core philosophy. Everlaw is FedRAMP certified, operates on AWS GovCloud (US), and designed to address the most stringent U.S. government security and compliance requirements. Take a look at how Everlaw is setting the bar in cloud security to protect your data with the highest cloud security standards.
